members.member: This is really the queued session state until the event thread actually processes the event and hands it to the watcher. But for all intents and purposes this is the state.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ClientConnectionRequestProducer.ReceiveAsynch(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary:
process the receiving mechanism in asynchronous manner. Zookeeper server sent data in two main parts part(1) -> contain the length of the part(2) part(2) -> contain the interest information
Part(2) may deliver in two or more segments so it is important to handle this situation properly

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ClientConnectionRequestProducer.DoSend(ZooKeeperNet.Packet)
member.summary: send packet to server there's posibility when server closed the socket and client try to send some packet, when this happen it will throw exception the exception is either IOException, NullReferenceException and/or ObjectDisposedException so it is mandatory to catch these excepetions

members.member: This hashtable lists the paths of the ephemeral nodes of a session.
this is map from longs to acl's. It saves acl's being stored for each datanode.
this a map from acls to long.
these are the number of acls that we have in the datatree
This Id represents anyone.
This Id is only usable to set ACLs. It will get substituted with the Id's the client authenticated with.
This is a completely open ACL .
This ACL gives the creators authentication id's all permissions.
This ACL gives the world the ability to read.

member.name: T:ZooKeeperNet.IO.BigEndianBitConverter
member.summary: Implementation of EndianBitConverter which converts to/from big-endian byte arrays.

member.name: T:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter
member.summary: Equivalent of System.BitConverter, but with either endianness.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.DoubleToInt64Bits(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified double-precision floating point number to a 64-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.Int64BitsToDouble(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts the specified 64-bit signed integer to a double-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.SingleToInt32Bits(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the specified single-precision floating point number to a 32-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.Int32BitsToSingle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the specified 32-bit signed integer to a single-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A single-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToBoolean(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value converted from one byte at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: true if the byte at startIndex in value is nonzero; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToChar(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Unicode character converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A character formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToDouble(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a double-precision floating point number converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A double precision floating point number formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToSingle(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a single-precision floating point number converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A single precision floating point number formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToInt16(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 16-bit signed integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit signed integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit signed integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 64-bit signed integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToUInt16(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 16-bit unsigned integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit unsigned integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToUInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit unsigned integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 32-bit unsigned integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToUInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 64-bit unsigned integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.CheckByteArgument(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the given argument for validity.
member.exception: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus bytesRequired.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.CheckedFromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the arguments for validity before calling FromBytes (which can therefore assume the arguments are valid).
member.param: The bytes to convert after checking
The index of the first byte to convert
The number of bytes to convert

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert the given number of bytes from the given array, from the given start position, into a long, using the bytes as the least significant part of the long. By the time this is called, the arguments have been checked for validity.
member.param: The index of the first byte to convert
The number of bytes to use in the conversion
member.returns: The converted number

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.
member.remarks: All the elements of value are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array starting at a specified array position.
member.remarks: The elements from array position startIndex to the end of the array are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from a specified number of bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.param: The number of bytes to convert.
member.remarks: The length elements from array position startIndex are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.ToDecimal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a decimal value converted from sixteen bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A decimal formed by sixteen bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the specified decimal value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 16.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.CopyBytes(System.Decimal,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified decimal value into the specified byte array, beginning at the specified index.
member.param: The byte array to copy the bytes into
The first index into the array to copy the bytes into

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array with the given number of bytes formed from the least significant bytes of the specified value. This is used to implement the other GetBytes methods.
member.param: The value to get bytes for
The number of significant bytes to return

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the specified Boolean value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 1.

member.summary: Returns the specified Unicode character value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 2.

member.summary: Returns the specified double-precision floating point value as an array of bytes.

member.summary: Returns the specified 16-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 2.

member.summary: Returns the specified 32-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 4.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the specified 64-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 8.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the specified single-precision floating point value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 4.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns the specified 16-bit unsigned integer value as an array of bytes.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns the specified 64-bit unsigned integer value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 8.

The number of significant bytes to copy

The first index into the array to copy the bytes into

member.summary: Returns a big-endian bit converter instance. The same instance is always returned.

member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.

member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.

member.name: T:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader
member.summary: Equivalent of System.IO.BinaryReader, but with either endianness, depending on the EndianBitConverter it is constructed with. No data is buffered in the reader; the client may seek within the stream at will.

member.name: F:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.disposed
member.summary: Whether or not this reader has been disposed yet.

member.name: F:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.decoder
member.summary: Decoder to use for string conversions.

member.name: F:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.byteBuffer
member.summary: Buffer used for temporary storage before conversion into primitives

member.name: F:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.charBuffer
member.summary: Buffer used for temporary storage when reading a single character

member.name: F:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.minBytesPerChar
member.summary: Minimum number of bytes used to encode a character

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.#ctor(ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Equivalent of System.IO.BinaryWriter, but with either endianness, depending on the EndianBitConverter it is constructed with.
member.param: Converter to use when reading data

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.#ctor(ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBitConverter,System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Constructs a new binary reader with the given bit converter, reading to the given stream, using the given encoding.
member.param: Converter to use when reading data
Encoding to use when reading character data

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the reader, including the underlying stream..

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Seek(System.Int32,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeks within the stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the stream.
member.returns: The byte read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadSByte
member.summary: Reads a single signed byte from the stream.
member.returns: The byte read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a boolean from the stream. 1 byte is read.
member.returns: The boolean read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt16
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 2 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 16-bit integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt32
member.summary: Reads a 32-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 32-bit integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt64
member.summary: Reads a 64-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 64-bit integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt16
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 2 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 16-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt32
member.summary: Reads a 32-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 32-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt64
member.summary: Reads a 64-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 64-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadSingle
member.summary: Reads a single-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The floating point value read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadDouble
member.summary: Reads a double-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The floating point value read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadDecimal
member.summary: Reads a decimal value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 16 bytes are read.
member.returns: The decimal value read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read
member.summary: Reads a single character from the stream, using the character encoding for this reader. If no characters have been fully read by the time the stream ends, -1 is returned.
member.returns: The character read, or -1 for end of stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of characters into the given buffer, starting at the given index.
member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of characters to read
member.returns: The number of characters actually read. This will only be less than the requested number of characters if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes into the given buffer, starting at the given index.
member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The number of bytes actually read. This will only be less than the requested number of bytes if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will return what is available.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytesOrThrow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will throw an IOException.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBigEndian7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the most significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string from the stream, using the encoding for this reader. A 7-bit encoded integer is first read, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Checks whether or not the reader has been disposed, throwing an exception if so.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream, throwing an exception if they can't all be read.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.TryReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream if possible, returning the number of bytes actually read, which may be less than requested if (and only if) the end of the stream is reached.
member.returns: Number of bytes actually read

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the underlying stream.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IO.LittleEndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IZooKeeper.Register(ZooKeeperNet.IWatcher)
member.summary: Specify the default watcher for the connection (overrides the one specified during construction).

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IZooKeeper.Create(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Org.Apache.Zookeeper.Data.ACL},ZooKeeperNet.CreateMode)
member.summary:
Create a node with the given path. The node data will be the given data, and node acl will be the given acl.
The flags argument specifies whether the created node will be ephemeral or not.
An ephemeral node will be removed by the ZooKeeper automatically when the session associated with the creation of the node expires.
The flags argument can also specify to create a sequential node. The actual path name of a sequential node will be the given path plus a suffix "i" where i is the current sequential number of the node. The sequence number is always fixed length of 10 digits, 0 padded. Once such a node is created, the sequential number will be incremented by one.
If a node with the same actual path already exists in the ZooKeeper, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NodeExists will be thrown. Note that since a different actual path is used for each invocation of creating sequential node with the same path argument, the call will never throw "file exists" KeeperException.
If the parent node does not exist in the ZooKeeper, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoNode will be thrown.
An ephemeral node cannot have children. If the parent node of the given path is ephemeral, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoChildrenForEphemerals will be thrown.
This operation, if successful, will trigger all the watches left on the node of the given path by exists and getData API calls, and the watches left on the parent node by getChildren API calls.
If a node is created successfully, the ZooKeeper server will trigger the watches on the path left by exists calls, and the watches on the parent of the node by getChildren calls.
The maximum allowable size of the data array is 1 MB (1,048,576 bytes). Arrays larger than this will cause a KeeperExecption to be thrown.
member.param: specifying whether the node to be created is ephemeral and/or sequential.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IZooKeeper.Delete(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Delete the node with the given path. The call will succeed if such a node exists, and the given version matches the node's version (if the given version is -1, it matches any node's versions).
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoNode will be thrown if the nodes does not exist.
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.BadVersion will be thrown if the given version does not match the node's version.
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NotEmpty will be thrown if the node has children.
This operation, if successful, will trigger all the watches on the node of the given path left by exists API calls, and the watches on the parent node left by getChildren API calls.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IZooKeeper.Exists(System.String,ZooKeeperNet.IWatcher)
member.summary:
Return the stat of the node of the given path. Return null if no such a node exists.
If the watch is non-null and the call is successful (no exception is thrown), a watch will be left on the node with the given path. The watch will be triggered by a successful operation that creates/delete the node or sets the data on the node.
member.returns: the stat of the node of the given path; return null if no such a node exists.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.IZooKeeper.Exists(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.summary: Close this client object. Once the client is closed, its session becomes invalid. All the ephemeral nodes in the ZooKeeper server associated with the session will be removed. The watches left on those nodes (and on their parents) will be triggered.

members.member: Creates a new instance of BinaryInputArchive
Creates a new instance of BinaryOutputArchive

All non-specific keeper exceptions should be constructed via this factory method in order to guarantee consistency in error codes and such. If you know the error code, then you should construct the special purpose exception directly. That will allow you to have the most specific possible declarations of what exceptions might actually be thrown.
@param code The error code of your new exception. This will also determine the specific type of the exception that is returned. @return The specialized exception, presumably to be thrown by the caller.
Read the error Code for this exception @return the error Code for this exception
Read the path for this exception @return the path associated with this error, null if none

Codes which represent the various KeeperException types. This enum replaces the deprecated earlier static final int constants. The old, deprecated, values are in "camel case" while the new enum values are in all CAPS.
Everything is OK

System and server-side errors. This is never thrown by the server, it shouldn't be used other than to indicate a range. Specifically error codes greater than this value, but lesser than {@link #APIERROR}, are system errors.
A runtime inconsistency was found
A data inconsistency was found
Connection to the server has been lost
Error while marshalling or unmarshalling data
Operation is unimplemented
Operation timeout
Invalid arguments

API errors. This is never thrown by the server, it shouldn't be used other than to indicate a range. Specifically error codes greater than this value are API errors (while values less than this indicate a {@link #SYSTEMERROR}).
Node does not exist
Not authenticated
Version conflict
Ephemeral nodes may not have children
The node already exists
The node has children
The session has been expired by the server
Invalid callback specified
Invalid ACL specified
Client authentication failed
Session moved to another server, so operation is ignored
@see Code#APIERROR
@see Code#AUTHFAILED
@see Code#BADARGUMENTS
@see Code#BADVERSION
@see Code#CONNECTIONLOSS
@see Code#DATAINCONSISTENCY
@see Code#INVALIDACL
@see Code#INVALIDCALLBACK
@see Code#MARSHALLINGERROR
@see Code#NOAUTH
@see Code#NOCHILDRENFOREPHEMERALS
@see Code#NODEEXISTS
@see Code#NONODE
@see Code#NOTEMPTY
@see Code#OPERATIONTIMEOUT
@see Code#RUNTIMEINCONSISTENCY
@see Code#SESSIONEXPIRED
@see Code#SESSIONMOVED
@see Code#SYSTEMERROR
@see Code#UNIMPLEMENTED
Client's view of the path (may differ due to chroot) *
Servers's view of the path (may differ due to chroot) *

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ZooKeeper.#ctor(System.String,System.TimeSpan,ZooKeeperNet.IWatcher)
member.summary:
To create a ZooKeeper client object, the application needs to pass a connection string containing a comma separated list of host:port pairs, each corresponding to a ZooKeeper server.
Session establishment is asynchronous. This constructor will initiate connection to the server and return immediately - potentially (usually) before the session is fully established. The watcher argument specifies the watcher that will be notified of any changes in state. This notification can come at any point before or after the constructor call has returned.
The instantiated ZooKeeper client object will pick an arbitrary server from the connectstring and attempt to connect to it. If establishment of the connection fails, another server in the connect string will be tried (the order is non-deterministic, as we random shuffle the list), until a connection is established. The client will continue attempts until the session is explicitly closed.
Added in 3.2.0: An optional "chroot" suffix may also be appended to the connection string. This will run the client commands while interpreting all paths relative to this root (similar to the unix chroot command).
member.param: comma separated host:port pairs, each corresponding to a zk server. e.g. "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002" If the optional chroot suffix is used the example would look like: "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002/app/a" where the client would be rooted at "/app/a" and all paths would be relative to this root - ie getting/setting/etc... "/foo/bar" would result in operations being run on "/app/a/foo/bar" (from the server perspective).
a watcher object which will be notified of state changes, may also be notified for node events

member.summary:
Create a node with the given path. The node data will be the given data, and node acl will be the given acl.
The flags argument specifies whether the created node will be ephemeral or not.
An ephemeral node will be removed by the ZooKeeper automatically when the session associated with the creation of the node expires.
The flags argument can also specify to create a sequential node. The actual path name of a sequential node will be the given path plus a suffix "i" where i is the current sequential number of the node. The sequence number is always fixed length of 10 digits, 0 padded. Once such a node is created, the sequential number will be incremented by one.
If a node with the same actual path already exists in the ZooKeeper, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NodeExists will be thrown. Note that since a different actual path is used for each invocation of creating sequential node with the same path argument, the call will never throw "file exists" KeeperException.
If the parent node does not exist in the ZooKeeper, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoNode will be thrown.
An ephemeral node cannot have children. If the parent node of the given path is ephemeral, a KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoChildrenForEphemerals will be thrown.
This operation, if successful, will trigger all the watches left on the node of the given path by exists and getData API calls, and the watches left on the parent node by getChildren API calls.
If a node is created successfully, the ZooKeeper server will trigger the watches on the path left by exists calls, and the watches on the parent of the node by getChildren calls.
The maximum allowable size of the data array is 1 MB (1,048,576 bytes). Arrays larger than this will cause a KeeperExecption to be thrown.
member.param: specifying whether the node to be created is ephemeral and/or sequential.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ZooKeeper.Delete(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Delete the node with the given path. The call will succeed if such a node exists, and the given version matches the node's version (if the given version is -1, it matches any node's versions).
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NoNode will be thrown if the nodes does not exist.
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.BadVersion will be thrown if the given version does not match the node's version.
A KeeperException with error code KeeperException.NotEmpty will be thrown if the node has children.
This operation, if successful, will trigger all the watches on the node of the given path left by exists API calls, and the watches on the parent node left by getChildren API calls.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ZooKeeper.WatchRegistration.Register(System.Int32)
member.summary: Register the watcher with the set of watches on path.
member.param: the result code of the operation that attempted to add the watch on the path.

member.name: M:ZooKeeperNet.ZooKeeper.WatchRegistration.ShouldAddWatch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determine whether the watch should be added based on return code.
member.param: the result code of the operation that attempted to add the watch on the node
member.returns: true if the watch should be added, otw false

member.name: T:ZooKeeperNet.ZooKeeper.ExistsWatchRegistration
member.summary: Handle the special case of exists watches - they add a watcher even in the case where NONODE result code is returned.
